dialogues.speaker: BURNED OUT ROW OF STORES.
dialogues.text: His is the only one still    occupied, and it doesn't loo permanent. In the window    is a cardboard, handwritten s "Kwan's Shaolin Kung Fu".    What remains visible behind the security grate is an    IMPRESSION of people moving a around.

dialogues.speaker: KWAN'S SHAOLIN KUNG FU SCHOOL.
dialogues.text: The students are doing their own thing, and they are a mi and young, men and women. They are not dressed alike, as be in a Karate school: they are dressed in old T-shirts a sweat pants. This is not a wealthy school, by any means, typified by the appearance of SIFU KWAN, who is walking t students as they train. He is wizened old man, 70 years o a day, and he is dressed in a fraying Chinese jacket, scr shoes and a discolored Chinese T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG ADULT
dialogues.text: Struggling through a horse stance, his face in real pain. trying his best to hold the stance, but his legs are quiv drops out of the stance onto his knees. Master Kwan is ri him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sifu Kwan, was that long enough? It's been 10 minutes... Sifu Kwan shakes his head and puts his hands behind his b walks past the student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Shaolin Temple, in misty Songshan mountains, We monks trained in iron palm until our hands bled... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then we trained some more. He walks on, leaving a puzzled student behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting back into horse stance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not...

dialogues.speaker: KWAN
dialogues.text: As he walks around the different people training. As one moving through an intricate series of movements, he sighs rearranges her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiger grasps his tail, not hamburger! He    moves on, studying the room with his eyes, often gl the    door, and then toward the small clock on a table n It    is late, and Kwan is obviously waiting for someone he    is waiting, a young STUDENT comes up to Kwan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Kwan, when can I learn flying kicks? I see Bruce Lee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Lee actor, we fighters, warriors. A sparrow in flight is beautiful, but a side kick to the ribs is effective. Show me. The boy shrugs    and then    starts throwing side kicks. looking at the    boy and    half looking towards the doo The boy throws    three or    four kicks and then stops. Kwan watching    the door.    Kwan sees him, and turns ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Shaolin warrior lets nothing intrude. Continue, never mind. He continues to kick, and Kwan continues to look at the d Finally, the student stops kicking, half-heartedly bows t master, and then moves to the side of the workout room. K know he's gone. Kwan turns around, forgetting for a momen doing, and comes face to face with the mother of a studen RODRIGUEZ, and she is holding a uniform of some sort. She widely at him and holds up the uniform. It is beautiful, hand made, and on the back is embroidered: "Kwan's Shaoli underneath that is "Drew Carson". Kwan takes in the entir while the rest of the class is gathering around to have a are all very impressed. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never in my days at the Shaolin Temple have I seen uniform as beautiful as this. Thank you, Mrs. Rodriguez. I wish Drew were here to thank you himself. Ta ma de! This last he says looking at the empty door. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only hope it brings him luck in the tournament. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck is no concern, Mrs. Rodriguez. Shaolin warriors depend on heart and soul В­ that's how they saved the T'ang emporer. He looks again at the door, then claps his hands together his students around him. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xie Xie, Mrs. Rodriguez. (to class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During my time training at the Shaolin Temple, the birthp martial arts, I was lucky (glance at Mrs. Rodriguez)... e fortunate to have the best instructors in the world train there was also time for individual training В­ where skil like the blade of a sword. Now, it is that time for you. He turns to go. One of the students, before he can leave, clears his thro STUDENT 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want us to do? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the blind follow the blind, they both fall over the cliff. Understand? STUDENT 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The others mutter "No" and shake their heads, confused. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter. He exits, leaving his students staring vacantly after him They look at each other, honestly not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GARAGE.
dialogues.text: It is kind of spooky, and there are no lights on outside. candlelight inside, and it is moving around В­ an effect ghost carrying a candelabra.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR.
dialogues.text: The area is dilapidated, but very clean, with all kinds o and Chinese paraphenalia lying around. Around the corner spooky light, and (with music building to a crescendo), w CARSON, a    muscular 16/17 year old, bowls of flaming wa shoulders,    moving through the garage, practicing his k maneuvers.    He is kicking, punching, etc., occasionally wax on his    skin (INSERT). In the background is a TV, and on it is showing a martial

dialogues.speaker: KWAN
dialogues.text: Who is quietly settling into a shadowy corner of the gara Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he continues to move around the workout area, his arms moving as he tries to match the movements on the TV. Suddenly, Kwan jumps out of the shadows, attacking. Drew instantly, evading the attack, the wax sloshing around in but not spilling (INSERT SHOT HERE). Kwan continues the a Drew evades, their movements matching the movements on th move for move. It is a beautiful ballet, and Drew ends it Kwan down to the ground. When Kwan hits the ground, hard, lit by the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who, for the first time, sees that it is Kwan. DREW

dialogues.speaker: MASTER KWAN
dialogues.text: He hurries over to his master, a concerned look on his fa He leans down to help Kwan up, forgetting about the bowls It pours down on Kwan, scalding him, as well as running d chest. Kwan struggles to get up, while at the same time t wipe the hot wax off. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Kwan! I'm sorry, very sorry! KWAN (blustering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm OK, never mind! What are you doing anyway?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Is taking the glued-on cups of wax off his shoulders, whi the already hard wax off his chest. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practicing. I saw it in this movie... Kwan shakes his head and walks over to Drew, standing in him. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you come to class? Why waste time with this... Should study tapes of opponent. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll still win. Besides, the Shaolin monks never had tapes to study... they did it this way... right? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite В­ our drills at the temple had meaning. If we had tapes, we would have watched them. Drew starts to protest, but Kwan doesn't even let him sta KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The    warrior who knows himself and his opponent will w 100    times in 100 battles." Study the tapes I gave you. All    these years of one on one training В­ you're the b I've    ever taught. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best white boy, maybe. Just fight like a Shaolin warrior В­ the rest will take care of itself. (picks up tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face reality, before it breaks your jaw! Drew holds out his hand for the tape, and Kwan slaps it i hand. Drew smiles a defeated smile and turns toward the V Drew's stepfather, BOB, walks in. He is a big, overweight is very angry. BOB (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you screwing around with this stuff again? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Bob, I'm not bothering you, am I? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your attitude that bothers me, son. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your son, Bob. Lay off. It is a threat, one that Bob almost takes up. Kwan feels in the room, and starts to say something. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Don't say a word, yellow man.

dialogues.speaker: KWAN
dialogues.text: Closing his already opened mouth. BOB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here because I told your Mom I'd see you were taken care of... after. At least respect my wishes, and make something of yourself... Stop wasting your time! DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) When I'm the best fighter in the country, I'm not going to let you be part of my entourage... BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean when you're in jail... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave me alone, Bob, OK? I NEVER asked for anything from you. He spins and kicks one of the hanging bags, then walks ou workout room, leaving Bob and Kwan standing alone. Kwan looks at Bob, who towers over him, and smiles sheepi KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure. Big tournament this weekend. He starts to walk out, but Bob follows him. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you have liked having to take care of a kid you never really wanted... ? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had the chance... Kwan exits, and we...

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR GOTTITALL ESTATE, A HUGE PALA
dialogues.text: The grounds are immaculate and huge, exquisitely kept and laid out. A gathering is around the pool and lawn area, w and his team are having an exhibition for their guests. P applause is

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: As he knocks out an opponent.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Applauding.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Taunting a different opponent. Trevor executes a beautifu and puts the guy down and out.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM
dialogues.text: (Psychologist, therapist, masseur, etc.) who are cheering

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: As he plays with the next fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you were good... ha! He knocks the guy out with a picture perfect kick. There denying that he's a superior fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you get me any quality sparring partners? The next guy comes up, but before they can start, the psy DR. PFEELGUT, calls for "Time" and motions Trevor over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's    not enough just to win, Trevor. You have to destr your    opponent completely, mentally and physically. Bea him    once, he's a threat. Humiliate him, and he'll fear you    forever. Trevor listens to this, nods his head once, and when Pfee leave, Trevor pushes him into the pool. Pfeelgut comes to the surface, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! Trevor goes back to the ring. He really takes it      to alternately playing with him and hurting him. As      the hold his own, the string to his pants comes loose      an fall down. He grabs for them with both hands, and      Tr back up, laughing with the rest of the group.

dialogues.speaker: PFEELGUT
dialogues.text: Toweling off, who is yelling to Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: GET HIM
dialogues.text: Trevor looks at him for a moment, not really understandin what the psychologist is saying. He lunges immediately fo (in SLOW MOTION) knocks the guy out while he is still try his pants up.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD AS THEY ENJOY THE SHOW IMMENSELY
dialogues.text: Trevor has learned the lesson of the day, and he walks of

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR BEING PAMPERED BY HIS ENTOURA
dialogues.text: The masseur is massaging his shoulders, a woman is doing and another is doing a manicure. An exercise physiologist over a computer print out with Trevor, when an old Korean MASTER KIM, comes into the room. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Master Kim. (to physiologist) I'll look at these stats later. Trevor indicates a seat near him, much lower than the one sitting in. The Korean master prefers to remain standing. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are all you guys named Kim? So, what did you think? KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick accent) You velly good fighter... TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learn English, will ya? And, tell me something I don't know... KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mountain lion doesn't ponder his weakness, and is therefore vulnerable. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Well, I'm pretty damn tired of this fortune cookie crap. (beat) You're history. Chaunce, get ride of the bum. The butler, CHAUNCY, comes forward and walks up to Master CHAUNCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come here any more, you hear? Over a little more to the left, Sam. The masseur nods and adjusts his technique accordingly. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard being me, you know. So much pressure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are streaming into the large building. The marquee reads "Diamond Nationals".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOME IDEAS, NOT IN ORDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Competitors warming up (wall front stretch, very high; on kicking another in the head В­ tap, tap, tap; two man rou practicing В­ another one jumps in?; two beautiful girls crowd assembling; group of kids waiting В­ call comes ove address system, they run off; stand outside selling high equipment; different styles of fighter's clothes В­ camo, stripes, "headhunter"; stern 9 year old girl doing kata; barely seen through their safety equipment fighting furio twins doing identical kata; breaking; etc.)

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND KWAN
dialogues.text: Walk into the area В­ Drew is dressed in the ill-fitting by Mrs. Rodriguez. People recognize him as he walks past.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Making his entrance. He is in a perfectly laundered and p and his assistant is carrying another suit pressed and re COMPETITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Trevor! What's the 2nd uniform for? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finals. COMPETITOR (after he's gone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocky bastard...

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: As he wins a fight.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he wins.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Drew watching, as he wins again.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AGAIN
dialogues.text: Winning. The stage is set for the finals.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: Drew and Trevor are already inside, waiting. Drew fights mosh of gear (different colors, different makes), while T decked out in designer, personalized gear. ANNOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting for the Grand Championship: Trevor Gottitall and Drew Carson. 3 rounds, max point. Gentlemen, bow to the ref, to each other... The referee gives them a signal and the fight begins. Dre his own, but Trevor is scoring. After several flashy move is over. Score: 6 - 1. We see Trevor's cheerleaders cheering.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Where he is given mineral water to drink, his shoulders a etc.

dialogues.speaker: DREW'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Kwan sheepishly offers him a sip of water from a battered 2nd round: Drew's getting beaten worse than the first rou he tries works. The score at the end of the round is 15 - of Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: ROUNDBREAK
dialogues.text: Drew is exhausted, frustrated and worried. Trevor is pump to go on forever. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only lose if you give up.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR'S CORNER
dialogues.text: The psychologist is exhorting him to destroy Drew. Trevor on his padded stool, smiling. The 3rd round starts. In this round, Trevor is destroying making him look ridiculous. A clinch comes, and (INSERT HERE) before they can break, Trevor grabs the dra around Drew's waist and pulls. They face off ("20 seconds" comes the call), and Trevor c Drew blocks, his pants begin to sag. Trevor, not trying t just trying to keep Drew's hands busy, keeps coming. Drew's pants drop lower and lower. When they get around his knees, he finally notices them, down to get them. Trevor drives and picks him up in a thr effectively showing Drew's bare ass to the world. CUT AWAY to crowd laughing, girls shocked, cameras poised recording, one mom puts her hands over her daughter's eye Trevor dumps Drew and scores the final point, just as tim A buzzer goes off, signaling the end of the round. Trevor thrusts his fists into the air in celebration. Dre crawl out of the ring, and everyone is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: As he is being interviewed by tv reporters. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never worried. He's no match for me. I just hope the 2nd place trophy is a belt! Crowd laughs, Trevor's entourage laughs the hardest.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he packs up his stuff.

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK NIGHT SKYLINE IN THE B.G.
dialogues.text: They are not talking, they are just walking, Drew kicking contemplating the future, and the past.

dialogues.speaker: DREW'S FOREARM.
dialogues.text: Kwan's hand COMES INTO FRAME and flicks the needle, sendi vibrating back and forth. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Drew sitting at the table in house, the acupuncture needle in his arm and his face pen sad. Kwan busies himself around the needle, trying to all pain of Drew's bruises. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time we get that guy... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No next time, Master. Maybe... (big sigh) ... you should find a new student. I just can't do it В­ I'm not getting any better! KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that. At Shaolin... He pauses, and decides not to tell another Shaolin Temple looks at him funny В­ this is very against his character. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a Shaolin monk once. I was only 5 years old at the time, but I remember it like it was yesterday. I was coming back from the market with my father. Soldiers stopped us and were taking the food we had just bought. It was all we had left to eat В­ no more money. These wer hard times in China, people were selling their children for food, and the soldiers had no right. Who can stop soldiers with guns, though? Yes? He pauses, and takes a sip of tea, checking the needle, a and turning it slightly this way and that. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the soldiers were leaving, a monk stepped out of the crowd and told them very calmly to put the food back. Well, naturally, they didn't. They pushed the monk, and the next thing I knew the soldiers were in the street, and the food was back in my father's arms. 5 soldiers, and they were in a heap on the ground, their blood mixing with the dust of the street. Kwan smiles with the memory В­ it is a sweet and heroic o KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd whispered "Shaolin", and he bowed to us, touched my cheek and smiled, then just walked on. I watched him until he disappeared in the distance. He was larger than life, a hero to a little boy of 5. I vowed then and there to become like him, fight for right like the Shaolin. He pauses again, looking at Drew. Drew meets his gaze, wo he is telling him this story. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never did, though. My family left China and ended up here in New York, a young boy's dream left behind in China. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... all the stories...? KWAN (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made up. I never trained at the Shaolin Temple. When I realized my dream couldn't come true, I convinced myself that it had anyway. It was a small step to convince other people. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given you all I can, and it's not enough. It was never enough. You're like a son to me, Drew, and you have all the potential in the world, but I can't take you where you want to go. Kwan takes the needle out of Drew's arm, and then rubs th it was with a cotton ball. KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, that should control the swelling. He watches Drew, who is pondering what Kwan has said. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not a Shaolin? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never were? KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Drew nods, an idea forming in his head. A slight smile fo face. Kwan was expecting him to be angry, he never expect KWAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are not a Shaolin warrior, then I will become one. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the Shaolin Temple В­ they can train me so I will never lose like that again. Kwan feels Drew's forehead. A long beat here as Kwan stud eyes. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit you so hard, you're delirious. I'll get a cold cloth. He starts to get up, but Drew grabs his arm and forces hi DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes intent) Don't you    see? You said    yourself I needed the right training В­    where better    than the Shaolin Temple? W holding me    here? I have    the chance to do what you couldn't.    I will go to    the Shaolin Temple. Kwan looks at him, realizes he's serious. He nods his hea the idea serious consideration. He smiles along with Drew KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must pay for your ticket... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'll make it there myself. KWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up on the stories of the Shaolin, and you can be those stories. You can live my dream for me В­ at least let me help you. Let an old man make up for the trouble he's caused. Kwan touches Drew's bruised cheek, fatherly love in his e nods his head, then bows in the traditional Chinese manne DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he packs for China.

dialogues.speaker: KWAN AND DREW
dialogues.text: As Kwan drops drew off at the AIRPORT. Drew takes his sui walks into the airport.

dialogues.speaker: OF BICYCLES AROUND HIM.
dialogues.text: Bicycle bells ring loudly as figures dressed in the same ride around him, their faces covered with scarves and sur against the northern China dirt. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL TIAN AN MEN SQUARE and the hu CHAIRMAN MAO on the front of the Meridian Gate of the For Drew continues his run, past a group of western-dressed l who watch him run by through dark glasses. Drew runs through a large city park, stopping to watch a older citizens going through Tai Zhi routines under the w willow trees there. Drew runs through an open air food market, picking his wa flipping fish, dead frogs and all kinds of fruits and veg People yell at each other, trying to get the best price. brushing his teeth in the street. A group of toddlers, st together with rope, walks down the street, their split pa glimpses of bare bottoms as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: SHOVING TO GET ON.
dialogues.text: Drew walks up to it, a huge backpack on his back. He hesi moment, then starts forcing his way onto the train like e else. He manages to get in through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no seats. Drew takes his pack off and sits on i Next to him is an old man, his teeth red and rotted from juice. The man smiles at Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew watches the countryside go by. Temples, farms and ri slide by, with an occasionally glimpse of the Great Wall.

dialogues.speaker: DREW GETTING OFF THE TRAIN.
dialogues.text: He stops on the platform for a moment, a huge colorful Ch billboard in the b.g. A transit cop quickly comes up to h him into motion. Drew walks on, passing a sign that reads

dialogues.speaker: DREW MAKING HIS WAY TOWARD THE SHAOL
dialogues.text: He stops at    a drink stand and orders one. As soon as h ringed with    people watching his every move В­ he feels movie star.    The woman in the stand hands him a drink, money out of    his hand. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Shaolin Temple? Shaolin? The woman just smiles and shakes her head, not comprehend

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Walking aimlessly. He comes to an intersection and sees a says "Shaolin Temple" with an arrow. He goes in the direc the arrow points.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP OF GIRLS STANDING OUTSIDE THEI
dialogues.text: Drew walks up and says hello. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, ladies! Can you tell me how to get to the Shaolin Temple? They titter with laughter, covering their mouths with the Drew is not really amused, however, he is frustrated and DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shaolin Temple? How hard can that be? Geez, doesn't anyone speak English here?

dialogues.speaker: ASHEMA
dialogues.text: As she pushes her way to the front of the group. She is a beautiful young woman. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. But wouldn't it make more sense for you to speak Chinese than to expect us to speak English? DREW (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I apologize В­ I've just been trying to get to the temple for a long time now. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to find the temple? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not without pride) I am going to join the temple as a monk. Ashema translates this for her friends, and they titter a gesture to Drew's longish hair and laugh, and then make s at martial arts movements. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going that way В­ I can take you. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a car? ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next best thing. (beat) This is a Chinese car. She pulls out her standard-issue black bicycle В­ she has it, however, with some colorful additions. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop on. Drew does, and they take off, the girls from the school t they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: ASHEMA PEDALING DREW.
dialogues.text: It is not the most stable ride В­ Ashema is struggling to while Drew is doing his best to stay on the bike.

dialogues.speaker: DREW PEDALING ASHEMA.
dialogues.text: He is riding strongly, and she is comfortable in the back getting stares from the people they pass, but Ashema seem enjoying the attention. Drew hits a bump, and Ashema hold a little tighter. Neither of them mind В­ in fact, Drew s for more bumps. He pulls around the corner into a wide area lined with dr stands. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEMPLE.
dialogues.text: This is it В­ the temple he came halfway around the world Shaolin Temple, the birthplace of the martial arts. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Ashema climbs off the back and takes the bike from Drew, his awe-struck face. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to help my grandfather with our stand. If you get a chance, come by later. DREW (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, but monks aren't allowed to be around girls. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaolin monks don't need luck... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, thanks a lot for the ride. I hope I see you again. They wave at each other, and Ashema pushes her bike off. Drew turns back to stare at the front of the temple. He i all sink in. After a moment, he picks up his backpack and heads for th door. He pulls it open and disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLE INTERIOR AS DREW OPENS THE HE
dialogues.text: The muted half light inside is in direct contrast to the the day outside. Drew quietly closes the front door, and light takes over. He walks through the temple proper, and what follows is a temple shots, establishing the feeling of the temple:    the famous Shaolin monk painting, the depressi floor of    the training hall, the incense blackened wall temple,    the temple figurines, the red lanterns hanging ceiling,    a huge wooden carving of Bodhidharma, etc. No one is around. Drew continues to explore, looking for someone to talk to into another hall, following the O.S. sounds of CHANTING. Once inside this hall, he sees a group of monks, amid han burners and paper lanterns, sitting down on the floor cha rhythm. No one notices that Drew is standing there. The m are open, but they don't seem to see him. He stands there for a moment, then shrugs and walks out o He goes into a corridor, then passes the "Wooden Man Cham

dialogues.speaker: TRAINING AREA.
dialogues.text: All manner of training equipment is standing outside (woo posts, hanging targets, heavy bags, iron palm jugs, balan etc.). A monk, the DRILL SERGEANT (hereafter D.S.), is standing a wooden post, driving his hand into the wood. The post TREMBLES with every strike. Drew stands next to the monk, watching him intently. Agai takes no notice of him. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Master. No answer. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Busy, huh? Still no answer. The man is just slamming his hand into t over and over. Drew sighs and walks on. He goes down a path, and floweri are on either side of him. He can see the "pagoda forest" distance. At the end of the path, a monk, SAN DE, is swee path. Drew walks up to the monk and bows. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, may I ask you a question? No answer nor response. Drew's kind of tired of this trea DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal here? Is everybody deaf in this temple? Even if you heard me, you wouldn't understand, would you? Huh, baldy? Shine your head for a quarter? He walks off frustrated, wondering what he has to do to g He walks back into the chanting chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monks are still chanting. Drew stands there, listenin moving with the beat, until they stop chanting. Drew, thinking it was some kind of performance, claps his DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great! Great! The monks finally take notice of him, and they are shocke MONK 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tourists! Temple closed! DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can see me?!? Several monks rush up and start herding Drew towards the MONK 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very agitated) No tourists! No tourists! Drew stops their progress and makes sure he has the monk' DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a tourist! I want to be a monk! The monk stops, his face a mask of shock. He calls to ano and they have a short conversation in Chinese. ADMISSIONS MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, sir? ADMISSIONS MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The training is too difficult. Besides, Shaolin policy is no foreigners. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come all this way, from America, to get turned away. I want in. I want to become a Shaolin monk. ADMISSIONS MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people want and what they can have are often not the same. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this case. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, especially in this case. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving. Drew starts to sit down, intent on staying, almost like a going to hold his breath until he turns blue. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give me no choice. (to other monks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove him. He continues in a stream of Chinese, and the other monks and physically force him to stand up and start moving him door. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to be a monk! Drew is forced through the courtyard to the front door. They pass the monk who was sweeping up in the back of the watches with interest as they open the door and force Dre it, out of the temple. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WITH A THUMP
dialogues.text: A group of people stop and watch the foreigner. The templ closes with a solid boom. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What about my... The temple door opens again, and out comes Drew's backpac It lands next to him, but spews out a couple of pairs of and some socks. The people standing around laugh. Drew gathers up the clothing and stuffs it back into his sits there for a moment, then gets up and heads for the s and stands ringing the courtyard. He walks past a couple of the stalls, looking at the peop them. He doesn't see Ashema. He passes a tea stall, where is sitting down sipping his tea. The old man looks at Drew and smiles, and Drew is about t when Ashema stands up from where she was squatting behind ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Drew sits down heavily, putting his pack down next to him Ashema places a cup of tea down in front of him, the stea from it. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it a double. Rough day. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kicked me out...

dialogues.speaker: TABLE, NOW LIT BY CANDLES AND A LANTERN.
dialogues.text: A bunch of tea bowls are scattered in front of Drew, as i drinking heavily. He points to his teacup, and Ashema sha head. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had enough. Drew's shoulders slump even more. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's for the best, Drew. You belong in America. New York. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do this. I can't go home, not until I'm a monk. I'd be even more of a disgrace... The old man talks to Ashema for the first time. He chatte Chinese, motioning towards Drew. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Bau Bau. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bau Bau? ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My nickname for him. He wants to tell you a story about the temple. The grandfather keeps talking, even though Ashema and Dre don't want to listen. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is telling a story about a monk who was refused admission into the temple. It broke his heart not to be allowed to be a monk. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he do? Ashema says something to him, and he continues in Chinese ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He decided not to leave. He stayed in the courtyard until they let him in. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time В­ through the worst weather. He just sat there, unmoving, through rain, sleet, snow. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they let him in? ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they did В­ what kind of story do you think my Bau Bau would tell? He stayed in front of the temple until they could no longer say no. He went on to become one of the most famous monks in the history of the temple. Drew sits there, thinking, letting it all soak in. He the and smiles. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell your grandfather, your Bau Bau, he is a wise man. And that he tells a good story. The grandfather smiles at him, nodding his head. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Are you going home? Drew shakes his head. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm camping out. He starts away from the stand. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the temple. He walks off into the Chinese night.

dialogues.speaker: MIST-LADEN COURTYARD.
dialogues.text: The sun is barely coming up, and only a few shafts of lig illuminating the darkness. A figure can be seen sitting c in front of the door. It is Drew, backpack at his side. The front door opens and a monk pokes his head out to loo and he sees Drew sitting there. His eyes widen in shock, quickly disappears inside. Almost immediately, the door opens again, and the Admissi standing there, surprised and angry to see Drew sitting t ADMISSIONS MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home! You cannot stay here! No response from Drew. He just sits there, staring straig ADMISSIONS MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me? Go away! Drew doesn't move. San De, the sweeping monk, walks out of the open door, a him carrying a suitcase. He walks past Drew, noticing him there. He walks on. The Admissions Monk slams the door, angry.

dialogues.speaker: DREW SWEATING IN THE HOT SUNSHINE
dialogues.text: Sweat is running into Drew's eyes, and he is trying to ke stinging.

dialogues.speaker: DREW BEING TORMENTED BY LOCAL KIDS
dialogues.text: They are playing games around him, throwing stones at him with his hair and his clothes, touching the things in his (frisbee, football, walkman), etc.

dialogues.speaker: DRILL SERGEANT
dialogues.text: As he comes out of the temple, chasing away the kids. When they are gone, he turns to Drew. DRILL SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you give up? I think so.

dialogues.speaker: DREW SHIVERING IN THE DEAD OF NIGHT
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed, and it is obvious he is very uncomfo

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER AS IT CRAWLS OUT TO SEE DREW
dialogues.text: It lingers for a moment, then goes away.

dialogues.speaker: DREW BEING FED BY ASHEMA
dialogues.text: She is giving him food, and all he is moving is his mouth not speak.

dialogues.speaker: DREW SITTING IN THE RAIN
dialogues.text: He is miserable, and he is looking at the relative comfor stands around the temple, where there is food, warmth and spirit is wavering.

dialogues.speaker: DREW BEING FED BY ASHEMA AGAIN
dialogues.text: ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give this up, Drew! Please? No response from Drew. Just a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER, WHO IS BACK
dialogues.text: This time it stays even longer. Drew looks down at it and

dialogues.speaker: MONKS FROM TEMPLE
dialogues.text: Looking out the windows at the crazy foreigner in their c

dialogues.speaker: DREW IN COURTYARD
dialogues.text: As a school group comes through the temple. The children are tied together with a rope, and the teach to the crazy American. Drew has become an attraction!

dialogues.speaker: DREW, SURROUNDED BY OLD MEN
dialogues.text: They are marveling at his perserverance.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, WIND AND RAIN
dialogues.text: This time it doesn't seem to bother him so much.

dialogues.speaker: DREW WITH ASHEMA AND HER BAU BAU THERE
dialogues.text: Bau Bau speaks quickly in Chinese. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Bau Bau says, keep it up! He is proud of you... Drew nods.

dialogues.speaker: DREW SURROUNDED BY KIDS
dialogues.text: They are no longer tormenting him, they are playing aroun him. Drew is not moving, but he is part of their group.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, THE SPIDER NOW SITTING ON HIS HAND
dialogues.text: Drew stares at the spider, his companion in the vigil.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, BIRDS ALL AROUND HIM
dialogues.text: The birds are keeping him company, and they are singing f ANGLE ON DREW, THE FULL MOON IN THE B.G. Drew's form is firm and solid, the determination in his e seen as he stares at the moon. He will see this through.

dialogues.speaker: DREW STILL SITTING IN THE COURTYARD.
dialogues.text: The    old monk, San De, comes back, the same monk follow with    the suitcase. He looks at Drew, a little surprise face    at seeing the American still there. He doesn't st goes    into the temple, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Same as the first shot, all alone in the temple.

dialogues.speaker: COURTYARD, DREW ALL ALONE.
dialogues.text: The door to the temple opens and out comes San De, alone He walks over to where Drew is, stares at him for a momen down across from him. Drew tries not to look at him. San De runs his hand across his bald pate and smiles. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head is shiny enough already, don't you think? Drew, in shock at his ability to speak English, sputters DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You speak English? I'm sorry, I was just goofing... I apologize, master. I didn't mean to make fun of you... San De shrugs it off. Apology accepted. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to do? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to become a monk В­ they won't let me in... Hey, you're just a grunt, a janitor sweeping up and all, don't sweat it. It's not your problem... SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you sitting here? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the idea from a story about a monk who wouldn't leave. I thought... San De nods. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it been hard? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was at first. I was uncomfortable, in pain, actually, but as time went on, I got... into it, I guess. The sacrifice made me feel... in control, you know what I mean? SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Much of the training at the temple is in that direction В self sacrifice. Tell me more. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I was really bored, and very lonely. But then, things changed. Maybe it's like hitting the wall in running В­ it was like I became part of the courtyard, an I felt powerful. Even the spider became my friend... Drew opens up his hand to reveal a spider sitting in his DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an incredible experience В­ I said I'd do it, and did it. San De, watching Drew intently, smiles at this last. He s bows to Drew. Drew bows back, from his seated position. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you all the best. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same to you. San De turns and goes into the temple, leaving Drew still the courtyard, the setting sun in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: COURTYARD, DREW ALL ALONE.
dialogues.text: O.S. comes the sounds of gongs and drums. A crowd has gathered in the courtyard. Ashema and her gra in the crowd, and they work themselves up to where Drew i Drew turns his head, and a procession of kids about his a older and some younger) come walking into the courtyard. The front door to the temple opens wide, and a column of in their best saffron robes, are lined up waiting to rece The young men who are walking in all still have hair, and carrying some baggage. They begin to enter the temple. ASHEMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are disciples. This is the last class for fighting monks at Shaolin. Drew, very concerned, watches as the monks-to-be file thr temple doors. The mothers and fathers of the boys watch proudly as the through. The temple doors close.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who is crushed. His chance is gone. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Drew. It was a good effort. Drew is sitting there, trying to understand what is happe the door to the temple opens again. The Drill Sergeant ap doorway and impatiently motions for Drew to come in. The crowd has stopped and is watching the drama unfold. Drew gets up warily, expecting some trick. The Drill Sergeant motions again, wanting Drew to hurry u Drew looks at Ashema and her Bau Bau and smiles. He picks backpack and starts towards the temple, limping from sitt long. The crowd goes crazy, clapping and yelling. Drew runs into the temple. The door closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR OF TEMPLE.
dialogues.text: The line of disciples has stopped, waiting for Drew. Drew in hand, takes his place at the end of the line. They parade past a line of monks assembled in the courtya the temple. As they walk by, some of the monks look nonplused, while put out by the fact that Drew is among them. Several of the disciples turn around to look at Drew, and are openly hostile to him. They file up to a raised platform, on which stand 20 monk holding a scroll in their hands, one monk for every new d A gong sounds, and the questions begin.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST DISCIPLE
dialogues.text: Who is asked... MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you accept the authority of the Shaolin patriarchs? DISCIPLE 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, without pause.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you renounce the earthly world? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure do, master. You bet. The monk pauses, for that is not the ritual answer to the The Drill Sergeant comes up to him and whispers in his ea monk then continues. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you abide by the rules of the temple, even if it means death? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. The Drill Sergeant comes up behind Drew and WHACKS him in with his elbow. DRILL SERGEANT (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer "Yes, without pause." DREW (rubbing his side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, without pause.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DISCIPLE
dialogues.text: MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the patriarch of the Shaolin Temple? DISCIPLE 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodhidharma.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you accept the shr fu at the Shaolin Temple as your spiritual leaders? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, without pause. The Drill Sergeant nods his head. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will a fighting monk ever use his skills for personal gain? Drew pauses, looking at the Drill Sergeant. The D.S. nods on. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, without pause. The D.S. puts his hands over his eyes. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, no, of course not. Then, another gong sounds, and the quizzing is concluded. A figure moves down a corridor in beautiful robes. Everyo down, their eyes on the floor, to the figure, who is movi the raised platform in the center. Drew, also bowed down, sneaks a peak at the figure. It is San De! San De catches his eye and smiles slightly. He winks at D clears his throat. Everyone stands up again. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do these disciples accept the authority of the Shaolin Temple? DRILL SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, without pause, Master San De.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who now knows that the monk he called a "Janitor" is the DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) I'll be damned! The DISCIPLE next to him, GAO, pokes him sharply in the r GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his side) Oh, unbelievable, in the same place... SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they ready to begin their training? DRILL SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, let us welcome them into our ranks! Gongs go off, firecrackers are set off, and a special fla on the flag pole. A roar comes from the crowd outside.

dialogues.speaker: THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: All of whom are happy. All, that is, except for Gao, who at Drew. Drew, notices the stare. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem, man? GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, American...

dialogues.speaker: SAN DE
dialogues.text: When the noise subsides. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your training begins tomorrow. For now, your shr fu will introduce you to our temple. Welcome to Shaolin. San De walks away, and the disciples are split into sever "platoons". Drew is matched up with the Drill Sergeant, a also in his group. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, just great. They are motioned to follow Gao out of the courtyard and temple proper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew walks behind the other disciples, who are lining up robes. As he takes his place in line, a monk comes up to backpack. Drew resists, and a tug of war ensues. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, man? MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must surrender this. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man! Get your own... The Drill Sergeant sees the scuffle and walks over. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is unseemly to argue like this. Take the backpack into the sleeping quarters. (to Drew) Do not cling to material things В­ it is not good for you soul. He walks away, and Drew reluctantly gives up his backpack Drew lines back up, and is about to get his robes, when G over and takes them from him. Drew immediately shoves him to grab the robes back. Gao smiles and moves away, holdin up and away from Drew. Drew is pissed and ready to go after Gao. Before he can, another disciple, grabs another set of robes from the tab it to Drew, pulling him away from the confrontation. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with that guy? LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for Gao. He's trouble. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I hadn't noticed... Why'd they let him in, anyway? LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? Maybe for the challenge? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that was me... They both smile and walk off.

dialogues.speaker: MONKS HAVING THEIR HEADS SHAVED.
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES DOWN the line of monks, as their hair is in clumps. Drew is standing next to his chair, arguing wi about the haircut. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. James designs my hair, master. I don't think... D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will symbolize your final break from the outside world. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I just wear a patch? The D.S. shakes his head, and Drew sits down, unhappy. The barber starts on Drew's head, big clumps of hair fall the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE COURTYARD.
dialogues.text: They are running their hands over their heads. Drew comes building, his head shaved completely clean. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What outside world? I don't want to be seen by anybody... He rubs his hand over his head, and then sees the others. Li is smiling. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I look half as stupid as you guys do, I'm really in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: LED BY THE D.S.
dialogues.text: A number of cots are lined up side by side. The D.S. has bed to each monk. Drew finds his bed, which is right next GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want another bed. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? GAO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't sleep next to the American. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are no longer Chinese or Americans, Han or Mongol. We are Shaolin. Everyone is a monk. GAO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this monk smells! Drew unconsciously smells himself. He shakes his head. Li goes up to the D.S. and points to the bed he was assig LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will switch with Disciple Gao. D.S. nods, and then starts for the door. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep. No talking! We have an early day of training tomorrow. Gao collects his stuff and starts off to the new bed, hit with his shoulder. Drew trips him as he walks away, all d secretively since the D.S. is watching. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerk! Li comes over to the new bed, and in silence they get cli their respective beds. D.S. switches off the lights, then Drew stares up at the ceiling. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for what you did. LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York City. You? LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beijing. What is New York like? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. I'll tell you about... GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut UP! DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow me! Drew waits for a moment, fearful that the D.S. will be co in. He doesn't. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Li. LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wan an.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, SLEEPING
dialogues.text: All is quiet. Suddenly, a huge stick ENTERS FRAME, and it pauses for a Drew, before THUMPING down on top of him. Drew cries out when he is hit, and jumps out of bed, look around him. No one is there. A few of the disciples are m because he yelled, but there is nothing else there. Drew, belatedly, gets into a fighting stance, but no othe coming.

dialogues.speaker: GAO
dialogues.text: Who seems to be sleeping peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he climbs back into bed, bone-weary. He lies back down

dialogues.speaker: LATRINE.
dialogues.text: Drew stumbles in, bleary-eyed,    to relieve himself. He urinal, relaxing as he starts.    Suddenly, a huge stick across the rear end, the SOUND    reverberating through t Drew yelps and jumps, looking    around for the attacker. No one is there, and his underwear is now all wet.

dialogues.speaker: STIRRING THE MEAGER MIXTURE.
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Drew sitting with Li and some disciples. Drew makes a face. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding. The D.S. comes up behind and grabs the bowl from him. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it, don't eat it. He takes the bowl away. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say I wasn't going to eat it... Geez! He turns to the rest of the disciples. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least we start training today, right, guys? A chorus of Yeahs.

dialogues.speaker: WORKOUT CLOTHES.
dialogues.text: They are the standard fighting monk issue В­ suitable for training. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder what they'll start us with first? LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iron Palm? SHU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden Man, I think. WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it'll be basics, first day. Horse stance, kicks and punches... When they are all dressed, they run out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINING.
dialogues.text: In the b.g. are the fighting monks, going through their r

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTING MONKS
dialogues.text: As they go through forms or free sparring. There are SHOT throwing stars, working with weapons, etc. It is all very

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who is more excited than all the others. ANGLE ON THE D.S. As he walks to the front of the group. In his hand he is shovel. D.S. Bodhidharma, the patriarch of the Shaolin Temple tau to train the mind, we first have to train the body.

dialogues.speaker: WU, WHO SHIELDS HIS MOUTH AND WHISPERS
dialogues.text: WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basics, I told you. ANGLE ON D.S. Who motions to one of the monks behind him, who has a whe filled with shovels. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each one of you take a shovel. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're using the shovels as weapons? D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Weapons... (beat) ... in the war on infection. D.S. motions with his hand, and in the distance is the la building. D.S. (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be digging today, digging our new latrines. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latrines? Why? D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Shaolin fighting monk-in training does not ask questions. He just obeys. The D.S. leads the way to the latrine building, and the d follow, each of them carrying a shovel. Drew is trudging believing what they are doing. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came halfway around the world to dig latrines? I could have just joined the army...

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND THE OTHER DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: Digging with their shovels. Their training clothes are al sweated through and dirty. Their shirts are off, and thei muscles are bulging and shining in the hot sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he lifts up two heavy buckets of dirt on a pole, then pole on his shoulders, the muscles in his arms, shoulders straining. He walks off to the side of the area to dump i As he dumps the dirt, a pole appears and CRACKS across hi drops the buckets and falls to the ground. He gets up as he can, but there is no one to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: As they are working hard on the latrines. Drew is teachin American song as they work. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ain't no cure for the Shaolin Temple Blues... " OR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Working on a Chain Gang" OR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I fought the law and the law won" OR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "16 tons" The monks are singing along with him. All except for Gao.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND DISCIPLES AS THEY EAT THEIR LUNCH
dialogues.text: It is again very meager: a bowl of rice, a bowl of soup a of scrawny meat. Drew looks at it for a moment. The D.S. is standing over his shoulder. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any problems? Drew shakes his head and starts to eat, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As he loads up a two baskets of dirt onto his pole. He ge onto his shoulders, in pain, and starts to walk. Immediat D.S. is there in front of him. He examines the baskets. They are not full. He moves quickly and dumps both baskets of dirt. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) What'd you do that for? D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do a job well or don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: GAO AND THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: As they are in line for water. They each drink a large gl then move back to their work area. Drew is the last in li Drew gets to the front, the D.S. smiles and shakes his he D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, all gone. Get some more. Drew stares at all the water spilled onto the ground, the at the D.S., then forces a smile. He takes the proferred water (made of wood, with pointed bottoms and large handl D.S. indicates that they are to be held straight out to t work on the shoulder muscles. Drew turns and walks away, himself. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you, man. Oh, yeah... Gao is laughing as he watches Drew go.

dialogues.speaker: DREW FILLING THE BUCKETS IN THE STRE
dialogues.text: Once they are filled, he starts back for the temple. His are straining from the weight of the buckets. He goes over the path to the temple, having to negotiate chasms, etc. After various trials and tribulations, Drew the temple, his arms incredibly tired. The D.S. is there him. Drew, determined not to show any weakness, raises the buc little bit higher. He comes to the D.S., proud and defian motions for him to put the buckets down. Without thinking, Drew, puts the buckets down, and they b over, spilling their contents onto the ground. Drew tries them, but he's too late. The water has all spilled out on ground. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, I know. Get more water...

dialogues.speaker: DISCIPLES ALL IN BED.
dialogues.text: They are exhausted from their work. Drew is lying in bed, wide open, ready to get attacked.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: As his eyes go closed, finally.

dialogues.speaker: CARRYING HUGE BASKETS OF DIRT ON HIS POLE.
dialogues.text: He is balancing as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: GAO
dialogues.text: Who is working at the other end. He starts across the sam They come to the middle: a stand off. GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up and let me pass. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance, Gao. You back up. Gao smiles and shakes   his head. Gao starts forward, and in the leg with a leg   sweep. Drew tries to keep his bal fights a valient, but   losing battle. He falls over the in his buckets flying   everywhere. Gao wipes his hands o continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: DREW'S BLOODY HAND
dialogues.text: A huge splinter sticking out of it. He is in real pain. T walks over and looks at the splinter, and in one move pul D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heartlessly) Shaolin monks feel no pain. Rub some dirt on it and you will be fine. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: On a work break. They are watching the monks training in distance. It is all the more desirable because it is unat In the distance, a monk can be seen walking between two o They are leading him out. The monk continues walking until he walks right in front disciples. His face and body are covered with bruises and two other monks don't say a word, their faces grim. Li turns to the D.S. LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He failed to pass through the wooden man chamber. He must leave the temple. The D.S. walks off. LI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Wooden Man Chamber"! The ultimate test of a Shaolin monk... WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see his face? SHU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor guy. GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wasn't good enough. I wouldn't be surprised if half of us go out the same way. The D.S. appears and motions for them to work.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE INCENSE-FILLED MEDITATION CHAMBER.
dialogues.text: The monk in charge of the chamber is talking to them. MEDITATION MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breath in through your nose, out through your mouth. Imagine yourself sitting on the bank of a river watching your thoughts flow by. Clear your mind... Think of nothing. Drew sits, trying to think of nothing. He is not succeedi

dialogues.speaker: DREW WASHING DISHES, ALONE IN THE KI
dialogues.text: He bends over to get a dish, when a pole comes and SMACKS rear end. He turns immediately in one direction, but gets from the OTHER direction. Drew is furious, and he can't even see the attacker. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out, goddamn it! Show yourself! No answer, as we HOLD on Drew looking around.

dialogues.speaker: DARK BROWN LIQUID BEING POURED INTO
dialogues.text: Drew is walking with Li, having just dumped their buckets large hole. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is this 'night soil' stuff anyway? LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human waste. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man! You guys actually use this as fertilizer? That's disgusting! They turn to go back, and there is Gao, balancing a huge night soil over his head, peasant-style. He is on the sam they are going to walk on. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Gao. How you doing? GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little worried) Let me pass. He reaches down and plucks a stick out of the earth at hi then closes on Gao a little bit. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something on the bottom of your basket. Drew pokes at the basket for a moment, right over Gao's h he JAMS the stick in, and holds it there. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops! I think I found the problem. (beat) A hole. Drew pulls the stick out and watches as the night soil ca onto Gao's head. They back away as Gao goes running towar where the night soil is deposited. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Li) Well, somebody sure smells!

dialogues.speaker: THE DISCIPLES ARE WORKING EXTREMELY HARD.
dialogues.text: As they work, a group of fighting monks walk by after a w stops working and watches them pass. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. Suddenly, a bamboo pole CRACKS Drew on the shoulder. He t ready for a fight, only to see the D.S. standing there, t raised for another strike. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to work. Drew is about to say something, but doesn't. He returns t

dialogues.speaker: DREW MASSAGING HIS MUSCLES
dialogues.text: He is sitting with Li and a couple of the other disciples and Low. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an idea on how to get even with our beloved Drill Sergeant... They all huddle a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: D.S. AS HE WALKS ALONG THE PATH.
dialogues.text: In the b.g. can be seen Drew, Li, Wu and a couple other o disciples. They are waiting for something. The D.S. hits the trip wire and suddenly two bamboo poles towards him, ready to slam him in the shoulders. With one beautiful move, the D.S. breaks both poles, shat they hit his arms. The D.S. hardly breaks stride and continues walking. He l once, and sees the outline of the group of disciples.

dialogues.speaker: DREW AND THE GUYS
dialogues.text: Who are up and running as soon as they are spotted. They who was watching from another area.

dialogues.speaker: GAO WAITING OUTSIDE D.S. ROOM.
dialogues.text: He looks around, knocks, and then goes in.

dialogues.speaker: ENTIRE CLASS GATHERED TOGETHER.
dialogues.text: The D.S. walks into the front of the courtyard and addres group. Gao is standing off to the side, a smug smile on his face D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are all responsible for anything that happens within your group. What happened yesterday falls on everyone's shoulders. So, all of you will do double work...

dialogues.speaker: GAO
dialogues.text: The smug smile gone now.

dialogues.speaker: PRACTISING ZAZEN, SITTING MEDITATION.
dialogues.text: Drew is in the center of the room, and the sound of light heard.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: It is him, he is asleep! Suddenly, a bamboo shinai is SLAMMED across Drew's back, up. MEDITATION MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodhidharma meditated for 9 years without sleeping. Think you can manage 9 minutes?

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE GROUP LABORING IN THE FIE
dialogues.text: They are all singing "Chain Gang".

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SEVERAL OF THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: They are good workers, and they don't mind the hard work weather quite so much.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Working hard.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who is holding court. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here to train, not to be slaves! We're free men... MU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we swore to obey them... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uninformed choice is no choice at all! MU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stand up for our rights! If they don't even know we're dissatisfied, things will never change. GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't changed for centuries, why should we listen to you? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we men or mice? Sheep or the shepherd? WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you! The others are with him too, except for Gao. They are rea explode, and Drew has the match. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm for going to the Headmaster right now! They are all ready. They head for the door, but Gao doesn Drew stops at the door and turns to Gao. DREW (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're either with us, Gao, or you're against us. No answer from Gao. They exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: D.S.
dialogues.text: Heading for the same place but from a different direction

dialogues.speaker: GROUP ASSEMBLED OUTSIDE SAN DE'S CHA
dialogues.text: Drew goes to knock on the door, when it opens and San De there. The D.S. has just arrived. He looks at San De for instructions, but San De indicates that he will deal with DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master San De! SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else? DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have something to say... SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an interesting coincidence, as I was just on my way to your sleeping quarters to talk with you all. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I request permission to go first. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd better... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really, I want to... San De holds up his hand. He is the final authority. SAN DE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here at the temple,    we use a period of intense physica labor to test your    patience, and to teach you humility and self-reliance.    As you continue training, you will given chores every    day В­ remember the first time you me I was sweeping?    Physical labor keeps us humble.

dialogues.speaker: THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: Who tonight have been anything but humble. SAN DE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've all performed    admirably, and have learned an important lesson В­ to    obey your shr fu without questi Because of this, I've    decided to begin your martial training sooner than    what is prescribed. Tomorrow morning. The disciples can hardly believe their luck. SAN DE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what did you have to say to me?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who is sputtering now. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I mean we, just wanted to... thank you for the opportunity to be part of the illustrious history of the Shaolin Temple. (beat) Yeah, that's it. Right, guys? They all say "Thank you" as one, and then bow to the head their hands clasped in front of them. They turn away and the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: THE DISCIPLES
dialogues.text: As they increase their pace, almost running through the h their excitement.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR TO THE SLEEPING QUARTERS.
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it BURSTS open and in come the disciples, led b fan out into the room, Drew in the center. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this calls for a party! He runs to his backpack and pulls out a boom box with spe puts on some good old American Rock 'N' Roll. Everyone, but Gao, is moving in time with the music. Drew accomplished dancer, but the others are pretty bad. The entire effect of the bald-headed monks rocking out is Drew starts showing Li and Wu a couple of dance routines the swim, the twist, etc.). Everyone is having a great ti

dialogues.speaker: GAO
dialogues.text: Glowering, as he moves toward the boom box. He reaches for the "Stop" button. Drew blocks the arm, and a pushing and shoving match star GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to get us all kicked out! DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to have a party. Chill out! They push and shove into the middle of the room, a couple and punches thrown, then they face off, ready to duke it The party is raging, while Gao and Drew are the only ones to do battle. Just then, the door starts to open. Everyone freezes and the door, including Gao. Drew, meanwhile, has the presenc jump onto the boom box, shutting it off and hiding it wit

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: As the D.S. opens it and sticks his head in. He surveys the room, seeing the tableau of frozen monks, lying on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Who waves to the D.S. ANGLE ON THE D.S. Who knows that something is going on. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep. Lights out. He hits the lights and then closes the door. In the semi- room relaxes in a collective sigh. Drew stands up and pac stereo. Gao walks over past Drew. GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over, American.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE SAME SET OF MOVEMENTS.
dialogues.text: Kick. Punch. Kick. Punch. INTERCUT of feet striking the stone floor, depressions in testifying to the centuries of training this chamber has Through the door come the D.S., Drew and the others. They along one wall, watching the fighting monks go through th It is beautiful: powerful, graceful and intimidating. Their form done, they file out of the chamber, leaving th his group, along with one fighting monk. The D.S. motions line up as the monks had. D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will train 6 days a week, from 5 am to 9 p.m., alternating with work and meditation. Sunday afternoon is free time. D.S. lets that sink in, then motions for the monk to take MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to keep our bodies strong, Bodhidharma gave us a series of exercises and breathing techniques. Because the times demanded action, we developed Shaolin style wu shu from these exercises. He goes through a couple of martial movements. MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spirit of Bodhidharma remains. Training is like meditation. Be aware of everything, but aware of nothing in particular. Think not thinking. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, 'Think not thinking'? MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non thinking.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Confused.

dialogues.speaker: MONK
dialogues.text: Who doesn't explain any further. MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your training begins today, in this most sacred of training halls. The floor bears witness to the efforts of fighting monks from centuries past.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: Where there are depressions and worn spots, the result of of hours of training. MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Shaolin temple, we forge our bodies in the fire of our wills. We adhere to a vow of non-violence, unless someone else is in danger... Follow my movements... He starts moving through a series of techniques, and the disciples try to mimic his actions. He is moving around t they are trying to do what he is doing. Some are getting it, some aren't. Drew, used to a more individualized type of training, isn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand COMES INTO FRAME, grabs the wedge and pulls it bac ground. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Drew, along with the other disciples, and throwing these sharp wedges into the ground and pulli out. Their muscles are bulging with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE SMOKING BRASS URNS
dialogues.text: Filled to the brim with small stones. Drew is forcing his the urn in "Iron Palm" training.

dialogues.speaker: MONK ON A SET OF POLES
dialogues.text: He is going through a complex form, kicking and punching, missing or faltering a step. Some of the poles are as hig off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: GAO ON THE POLES
dialogues.text: He is less sure, but at least he doesn't fall.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Trying the poles. He starts out well, but he soon misses almost impaling himself on a pole. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this! D.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here at Shaolin, can't doesn't exist. Only won't.

dialogues.speaker: DISCIPLES PAIRED OFF.
dialogues.text: Drew is working with his friend Li. They are moving throu of techniques, ending with a flashy kicking technique whi blocked by a special Shaolin technique. Each time Li throws the final kick, Drew gets hit, HARD. His block isn't working. A monk comes up to him. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Block the way I showed you. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing him a block) This is the way I was taught. MONK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it this way. You won't get hit. Drew bows and turns to continue working with Li. By this however, the ranks have shifted, and Gao is opposite Drew Drew attacks first in the series, and Gao uses the block deflect Drew's kick. GAO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacingly) My turn. He attacks, and Drew gets to the final technique. He bloc he did before, and he gets slammed brutally by Gao. Gao stands over him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monk is alternately falling down and kipping up, fallin kipping up. Drew's group is working on several very athletic maneuver which Drew is especially good at. Gao, of course, is havi trouble. Drew tries a flying move and falls into a heap on the gro very angry, and he hits the ground with his fist. MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotions cloud the spirit В­ eliminate them. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't martial arts В­ it's gymnastics! MONK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
